d.description: Create anchor.ts and selection.ts. Implement createAnchor(), resolveAnchor() on MultiBuffer/MultiBufferSnapshot. Anchor survival through edits (insert/delete), bias behavior (Left/Right), replacement chain following. AnchorRange and Selection types. Batch anchor resolution with cursor reuse.
d.title: Implement anchor system

d.description: Batch replacement of all excerpts for a given buffer. Track replaced excerpts so anchors can follow the replacement chain. Returns new ExcerptIds.
d.title: Implement setExcerptsForBuffer

d.description: Add context lines before/after an excerpt. Clamp to buffer bounds. Update startRow for subsequent excerpts. Rebuild cache.
d.title: Implement expandExcerpt

d.description: Adjacent ranges merge, overlapping ranges merge, non-adjacent ranges stay separate. Merge tracking returns correct counts.
d.title: Implement excerpt range merging

d.description: clipPoint on MultiBufferSnapshot currently ignores bias parameter. Implement proper bias handling at excerpt boundaries.
d.title: Implement clipPoint with bias

d.description: Implement minimal viable renderer: measurement (fixed line height, character width), viewport (visible range calculations, scroll handling), and a concrete DOM or Canvas renderer. See src/multibuffer_renderer/ types.ts for interface.
d.title: MVP renderer implementation

d.description: Add WrapMap (prefix sum for buffer row ↔ visual row mapping), update measurement.ts for wrap-aware viewport calculations, rewrite DOM renderer loop to iterate visual rows with segment tracking, wire into demo with wrapWidth: 60.
d.title: Implement soft wrap in DOM renderer

d.description: Install web-tree-sitter, create highlighter.ts (parse + token extraction), theme.ts (gruvbox colors), update DOM renderer to build colored spans per token, wire into demo with TypeScript grammar WASM.
d.title: Add tree-sitter syntax highlighting to DOM renderer

d.description: Core text editing: cursor, selection, input handling, edit proxy, undo/redo
d.name: editing-v0

d.description: Add EditorState type with cursor (Anchor), selections (Selection[]), and focus state. Add EditorCommand union type for all edit operations (InsertText, DeleteBackward, DeleteForward, MoveCursor, ExtendSelection, etc.). These types go in a new src/editor/types.ts.
d.title: Define editor state types

d.description: Cursor movement commands: moveLeft, moveRight, moveUp, moveDown, moveToLineStart, moveToLineEnd, moveToBufferStart, moveToBufferEnd, pageUp, pageDown. Each takes an EditorState + MultiBufferSnapshot and returns a new cursor Anchor. Must handle excerpt boundaries (cursor skips between excerpts), line wrapping, and column goal preservation for vertical movement.
d.title: Implement cursor movement

d.description: Selection operations: extendSelection (shift+move), collapseSelection, selectAll, selectLine, selectWord. Selection is an AnchorRange with head direction. Must handle extending across excerpt boundaries. When selection exists and user types, selection is replaced.
d.title: Implement selection management

d.description: Add insert(point, text), delete(startPoint, endPoint), replace(startPoint, endPoint, text) to MultiBuffer. These convert multibuffer coordinates to buffer coordinates via toBufferPoint(), apply the edit to the underlying Buffer, then refresh the snapshot. Must handle edits within excerpts only (can't edit across excerpt boundaries). After edit, all anchors (cursor, selections) automatically adjust via the edit log.
d.title: Implement MultiBuffer edit proxy

d.description: New src/editor/input-handler.ts. Listens to keydown/input events on a hidden textarea (for IME support). Maps key events to EditorCommands: character input -> InsertText, Backspace -> DeleteBackward, Delete -> DeleteForward, Enter -> InsertNewline, Tab -> InsertTab, arrow keys -> MoveCursor, Shift+arrows -> ExtendSelection. Ctrl/Cmd modifiers for word/line movement.
d.title: Implement keyboard input handler

d.description: Mouse click sets cursor position (via hitTest). Click+drag creates selection. Double-click selects word. Triple-click selects line. Shift+click extends selection. Must convert pixel coordinates to multibuffer points through the renderer's hitTest.
d.title: Implement mouse input handler

d.description: Render a blinking caret at the cursor position in the DOM renderer. Convert cursor Anchor to screen coordinates (resolve anchor -> MB point -> visual row via WrapMap -> pixel position). Blink animation via CSS or requestAnimationFrame. Reset blink on keystroke. Hide when unfocused.
d.title: Implement cursor rendering

d.description: Render selection highlight as background color on selected text. Resolve selection AnchorRange to MB point range, then to visual rows. For each visual row in selection, add a highlight div or use CSS Custom Highlight API. Handle multi-line selections, selections across wrapped lines, and selections across excerpt boundaries (skip gap rows).
d.title: Implement selection rendering

d.description: Transaction-based undo/redo. Each user action (keystroke, paste, etc.) is wrapped in a transaction that records: the edit operations and the cursor/selection state before and after. Undo reverses the transaction and restores previous cursor state. Redo re-applies. Group rapid keystrokes into a single transaction (debounce). Store on the Buffer level, but EditorState tracks cursor snapshots per transaction.
d.title: Implement undo/redo system

d.description: Copy: extract selected text to clipboard. Cut: copy + delete selection. Paste: insert clipboard text at cursor (replacing selection if active). Use navigator.clipboard API. Handle multi-line paste. Ctrl/Cmd+C/X/V keybindings.
d.title: Implement clipboard operations

d.description: New src/multibuffer/rope.ts. A balanced B-tree of text chunks for O(log n) insert/delete/index. Each leaf holds a string chunk (target ~1KB). Internal nodes cache: line count, byte count, character count (like TextSummary). Operations: insert(offset, text), delete(start, end), line(row), lines(start, end), text(), pointToOffset(), offsetToPoint(). Based on Zed's SumTree pattern but simplified — no timestamps, no CRDT, just efficient text storage with cached summaries at each node.
d.title: Implement rope data structure

d.description: Swap BufferImpl's flat string[] + lineStarts[] with the Rope. All public API stays the same (Buffer interface unchanged). insert/delete/replace become O(log n) instead of O(n). snapshot() returns a rope clone (structural sharing). Existing tests must still pass — this is a pure internal refactor.
d.title: Replace Buffer internals with rope

d.description: renderAll() in demo.ts always creates viewport from scrollTop=0. Should read actual scrollContainer.scrollTop to render the correct visible range.
d.title: Fix renderAll to use current scroll position

d.description: When cursor moves (typing, arrow keys, click), scroll the viewport if cursor is outside visible range. Use renderer.scrollTo with 'nearest' strategy.
d.title: Auto-scroll viewport to follow cursor

d.description: InputHandler ignores paste events. Add a paste event listener that reads clipboard text and dispatches insertText command.
d.title: Wire paste event in InputHandler

d.description: Add a CSS blink animation to the cursor element for visual feedback.
d.title: Add cursor blink animation

d.description: After an edit, the highlighter's cached parse tree becomes stale. Need to incrementally re-parse or fully re-parse the edited buffer.
d.title: Re-parse buffer after edit for syntax highlighting

d.description: Test that Editor.dispatch({type:'moveCursor',...}) actually moves the cursor in all directions and granularities. Verify cursor position after each move.
d.title: Test Editor cursor movement via dispatch

d.description: Test Editor.dispatch({type:'insertText',...}) — single char, multi-char, newline, tab. Verify text appears in buffer and cursor advances correctly.
d.title: Test Editor text insertion via dispatch

d.description: Test Editor.dispatch({type:'deleteBackward',...}) and deleteForward — char, word granularity. Verify text removed and cursor positioned correctly.
d.title: Test Editor delete backward/forward via dispatch

d.description: Test that Editor.setCursor(point) places cursor at the given point and creates a collapsed selection there.
d.title: Test Editor.setCursor (click placement)

d.description: Test Editor.dispatch({type:'extendSelection',...}) — extend in all directions, verify selection range. Test that moveCursor collapses non-collapsed selection.
d.title: Test Editor selection extend via dispatch

d.description: Test that keyEventToCommand correctly maps KeyboardEvent-like objects to EditorCommands for arrow keys, backspace, enter, tab, Cmd+A, Cmd+Z, etc.
d.title: Test keyEventToCommand mapping

d.description: Clicking in the editor area does not focus the hidden textarea. No keydown or input events fire at all. The mousedown listener calls inputHandler.focus() but the textarea (positioned at left:-9999px) likely loses focus immediately or never gains it. Possible causes: (1) the scrollContainer mousedown handler fires first and the browser focuses the scrollContainer instead, (2) the off-screen positioning prevents focus, (3) event ordering between scrollContainer click handler and container mousedown handler.
d.title: Bug: Hidden textarea never receives focus — typing does nothing in demo

d.description: hitTest returns raw pixel coordinates without clamping to text length. Clicking past the end of a line places the cursor in empty space. setCursor (or hitTest) needs to clip the column to the actual line length.
d.title: Bug: setCursor allows cursor past end of line

d.description: Standard macOS editor keybindings — movement, selection, editing, line ops
d.name: keybindings-v0

d.description: Currently mod=metaKey maps Cmd+Arrow to word granularity. macOS convention: Cmd+Left/Right=line start/end, Opt+Left/Right=word. Cmd+Up/Down=buffer start/end. Need to add altKey (Opt) detection and fix all arrow/delete mappings.
d.title: Fix Mac modifier mapping: Cmd=line, Opt=word

d.description: Left/Right: move one character. Up/Down: move one line, clamp column. Already implemented — verify with tests.
d.title: Arrow keys: character movement in all directions

d.description: Cmd+Left = Home (column 0). Cmd+Right = End (end of line). Currently broken — mapped to word instead of line.
d.title: Cmd+Left/Right: move to line start/end

d.description: Opt+Left = previous word boundary. Opt+Right = next word boundary. Not currently wired (no altKey handling).
d.title: Opt+Left/Right: word movement

d.description: Cmd+Up = first row column 0. Cmd+Down = last row end of line. Currently not mapped for arrows (only Home/End).
d.title: Cmd+Up/Down: move to buffer start/end

d.description: Shift+Left/Right: extend selection one char. Shift+Up/Down: extend one line. Already implemented.
d.title: Shift+Arrow: extend selection by character/line

d.description: Shift+Cmd+Left = select from cursor to line start. Shift+Cmd+Right = select to line end. Currently broken (maps to word).
d.title: Shift+Cmd+Left/Right: select to line start/end

d.description: Shift+Opt+Left = extend selection to prev word boundary. Shift+Opt+Right = extend to next word boundary. Not wired.
d.title: Shift+Opt+Left/Right: select word

d.description: Shift+Cmd+Up = select from cursor to buffer start. Shift+Cmd+Down = select to buffer end.
d.title: Shift+Cmd+Up/Down: select to buffer start/end

d.description: Select entire buffer content. Already implemented.
d.title: Cmd+A: select all

d.description: Backspace = delete char before cursor. Delete = delete char after cursor. Already implemented.
d.title: Backspace/Delete: character deletion

d.description: Delete from cursor to previous word boundary. Currently mapped to Cmd+Backspace (wrong modifier).
d.title: Opt+Backspace: delete word backward

d.description: Delete from cursor to start of line. Not implemented — needs new 'line' granularity for delete, or a 'deleteLine' command.
d.title: Cmd+Backspace: delete to line start

d.description: Delete the current line (or all selected lines) and move cursor up. New command type needed: 'deleteLine'.
d.title: Cmd+Shift+K: delete entire line

d.description: Typing a-z, numbers, symbols inserts at cursor. Works via input event on hidden textarea. Recently fixed (preventDefault on mousedown).
d.title: Character input via hidden textarea

d.description: Split line at cursor. Already implemented.
d.title: Enter: insert newline

d.description: Insert 2 spaces at cursor. Already implemented.
d.title: Tab: insert indent (2 spaces)

d.description: When typing/inserting characters, syntax highlighting is not updated to reflect the new content. The highlight ranges appear to remain anchored to the original character positions — after editing, tokens are incorrectly colored because the highlights no longer align with the actual text. For example, after mashing keys over an import statement, fragments of keyword and string colors persist at stale column offsets.
d.title: Syntax highlighting breaks when characters are inserted

d.description: Renderer needs mousemove/mouseup tracking during drag. Editor needs extendSelectionTo(point) that keeps anchor fixed, moves head. On mousedown: setCursor. On mousemove (while dragging): extendSelectionTo. On mouseup: stop drag.
d.title: Click+drag to select text

d.description: MouseEvent.detail: 1=single click (setCursor), 2=double click (select word at point), 3=triple click (select entire line). Editor needs selectWordAt(point) and selectLineAt(point) methods.
d.title: Double-click selects word, triple-click selects line

d.description: renderAll() was using scrollTop=0 instead of actual scroll position, causing broken rendering when clicking/editing while scrolled. Unit tests can't catch this — need real browser tests that scroll, click, and verify visible content matches expected rows. Cover: click while scrolled, edit while scrolled, selection rendering while scrolled, drag selection across scroll boundary.
d.title: Add browser integration tests for scroll+render interaction
